briefdescription.para: The value should be displayed in hexadecimal.
The value should be displayed as an unsigned integer.

detaileddescription.para: Hint that indicates to the inspector how a value should be displayed if the inspector needs to display the value in a human-readable form.
Class that implements the GG_Inspector interface and outputs all inspected values through a logger.

memberdef.argsstring: (GG_Inspector *self, const char *name, int64_t value, GG_InspectorFormatHint format_hint)
memberdef.name: GG_Inspector_OnInteger

memberdef.argsstring: (GG_Inspector *self, const char *name, const uint8_t *data, size_t data_size)
memberdef.name: GG_Inspector_OnBytes

memberdef.argsstring: (GG_Inspector *self, const char *name, uint32_t data_type, const void *data, size_t data_size)
memberdef.name: GG_Inspector_OnExtensible

detaileddescription.para: Create an inspector that logs all values it receives through callbacks. NOTE: a limitation of the current implementation is that this object cannot be destroyed while it is still indirectly referenced by the logging subsystem, which means that once used, it can only be destroyed after GG_LogManager_Configure has been called to reset any current logger tree.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the logger to use when logging.
Logging level to use when logging.
Pointer to where the inspector should be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the object could be created, or a negative error code.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the GG_Inspector interface for a logging inspector object.

parameterdescription.para: The object on which this method is invoked.
